runs.comm: what happened here? prodigious swing across the left-hander deceives not only the batsman, but the keeper behind as well, with Gayle unable to get a grip on it as it flew through for five wides
better line now, much closer to the body, as he gets good carry off the deck
back of a length which goes across as the batsman is unable to get anything on it
first runs off the bat for Ireland now as this is blitzed away through cover
short of a length outside off which Stirling is not willing to engage with
fuller one which is edged away through third man as Stirling gets his tally going too
able to pinch a single on the off side to end the first over for Ireland with eight runs on the board already
shortish length which rises on the batsman as William defends off the back foot
this time punched away off the back foot towards the fielder at cover
fullish length going across which is sliced away through point, with some rather slack ground fielding allowing the pair to complete a brace
tries to scythe Roach on the up through cover, but ends up bottom-edging to the slip
short and punished by William as he shows off his back-foot play with a powerful hook through backward square
defended off the back foot as Ireland move to 16 after two overs
slipping down the pads as Stirling fails to glance this away
short outside off which is punished by Stirling as he cuts this away powerfully through backward point to pickup another useful boundary
leans forward before defending this length delivery, angling in to the off side
slants in from outside off as Stirling covers the line
short again and dispatched behind square with a pull
short of a length outside off which is punched away towards the off side
short of a length and slanting into the body as he tries to whisk this away through the leg side off the pads
short and follows the leg-stump line as he works with the angle to pull this behind square to find the boundary rope. Stirling living up to his reputation so far
this time crashed away on the up through point as Stirling runs the first one hard enough to return back for the second
tries to guide this one over the point fielder as he struck this intentionally into the ground, in a hope to hop this one over the fielder, but doesn't quite come off to plan
overpitched and simply drilled down the ground by Stirling, who is looking to put anything loose away
short of a length and defended off the back foot
goes round the wicket now to the left-hander as William defends inside the line

noise down the leg side as William looked to clip this off the pads. Holder goes up for the appeal, but the umpire doesn't seem interested in the shout. Looks like it may have come off the thigh pad anyways, nothing on snicko off the bat
fended away with a nice high elbow towards off
gets this to jag back a country mile as it collides into William's rib cage. Looks like he is okay though
has found a lovely line just outside off, getting this to nibble away upon pitching on a length
length on the pads which is flicked away to midwicket
short of a length and pulled away through backward square
back of a length outside off which is glided down to third man
looks to punch on the up through the covers, but locates said fielder inside the ring
pulls away this length delivery behind square to the boundary rider at deep backward square
short of a length and pulled through to deep square-leg
picks his spot at midwicket before lifting Roach with a short-arm pull through the region to get to the rope
length ball slanting in from outside off which is bunted away to the off side
brings up the length a touch as this one jags in on Stirling, who defends from the crease
shuts the gap between bat and pad as he defends to the leg side
shorter one which the batsman weaves out of its path, with even the keeper unable to get a grasp on it as it continued on to the fine leg boundary
length on and around off which is fended away to the off side
short and outside off, Stirling cuts and picks out backward point
starts from round the wicket as he begins with a shortish length that angles into the batsman, with William running this down towards third man
issues a helmet check to Stirling as he is late on the hook, with this crashing into the side grill as he tried to evade the delivery
we return to the action with Taylor offering up a leg-stump, low full toss which is eased away through midwicket for a brace

Stirling unafraid after that last hit on the helmet as he goes after this hook, but really wasn't in any control as he moved his head out of the way, with this one flying all the way to get over the boundary rope at long leg. Also gets Ireland to fifty
Taylor looks to test his resolve with another bumper that this time Stirling gets well out of the way. Seemed to come a lot faster than he had expected
jabs away this length delivery towards mid-off to pinch a single
far too early in the stroke as he attempts to crash this length delivery through the covers
bends his back before ramping this short of a length through to third man
short of a length and treated with respect by William
content to let this one fly through outside off to the keeper
short delivery which climbs too high over the batsman's head as he attempted to go after it with a hook. Called wide by the umpire
continues round the wicket to William as this length delivery is bunted away to the off side
that is the line and length as he gets this to nibble away after pitching, with William playing inside of the line
moseys down the track to try and slam this shorter one from Taylor over cover, but fails to make any connection

length which shapes away on and around off as Stirling is able to push at this, getting enough behind it to just get it over the rope despite the man at mid-off haring after it to try and pull it back
short ball which climbs well over the batsman's head. Looks like that might be one for the over
short of a length which rises on Stirling as he just about fends this one away to the off side
flashing blade from William ends up finding the man at point, who stops it dead in its tracks
short ball again that is really testing the resolve of these two Irish batsmen as William weaves away from the trajectory
begins his spell with a length delivery outside off which is worked away towards cover
William leans into this drive to this half-volley going across as he is stopped just before the extra-cover boundary, but not before they ran two
able to bunt away this back of a length going across towards point
blazes away through the region to get Stirling back on strike
short ball which Stirling throws everything at, but is unable to make a proper connection as Ramdin completes a lovely, diving take to his left
fuller length, just outside off, which is fended away to end the over
starts round the wicket to William as he darts one in just outside off which is driven to the off side
this time shifts his weight onto the back foot to defend from the crease

drags this one down the leg side now as William looks to sweep this round the corner, but ends up getting it more towards silly mid-on, who pounces on it quickly, which deters the Ireland captain from taking the single, instead getting back to his end, which he is able to do safely despite the throw and removing off the bails by Ramdin
defended by the batsman to the leg side
tucked away towards silly mid-on, who is equal to the task
this time driven down to long off to end Gayle's first over
dropped fullish length which is chipped uppishly at the bowler, who gets a mitt out in his follow through, but is unable to snaffle the chance
gets away a clip through square-leg, with the pair able to complete a brace
this time gets to the other end with this poke through midwicket
slips in a shorter one which climbs high on William as he parries away towards backward point
bowls a steepler on a middle to off line which William is not willing to flirt with
gets under this quick bouncer from Russell. Looks like there will be plenty of chin music for the Shamrock warriors
continues round the wicket as Stirling chips him over mid-on to get William on strike
looks for room to cut away behind square, but no dice

and Porterfield has to go as he looked to get on with it, going after this slightly wide delivery on a flatter trajectory, which he ends up getting a bottom-edge to which Ramdin is able to get his fingers under and complete the take. Porterfield goes for 23
Joyce doing his impression of the dismissal that got his captain, but is lucky not to get any bat on it
defended away as he lunged forward to meet the ball
turned to the leg side as the pair run the first one hard enough to come back for the second in time
fended away off the back foot towards the off side
flicks away this delivery slanting down leg behind square to get Joyce back on strike
full and going across as this is pushed towards the cover fielder
tries to carve one away past point, but it is stopped, but not before an initial fumble by Dwayne Smith
inswinging delivery on middle which is drilled back at the bowler
short of a length and slanting down leg as he brushes this off his pads behind square
nurdles away a single through midwicket
this time eased away off the back foot, but to the close-in fielder on leg
able to steer one past cover to get to the other end
seems to slow on the batsman as this goes in the air temporarily after he met the ball
quicker one now going across, which gives Stirling the pace he needed to work this away behind square with a powerful scythe
needles away a single now through midwicket to retain the strike
short ball which is worked with the leg-side angle to get it down to deep fine leg
ducks under this steepler on middle and leg. Called one for the over
delivers another bouncer and Joyce shows his quality with a hook over backward square which goes the distance. This one went 62 meters. Valuable runs for Ireland
fails to get away Russell through cover as he ends up dragging the stroke towards the bowler as he finished his delivery stride
better length as he shifts the line of attack just a bit more off-side, with this one bunted away
able to squirt away a run through backward point to end the over
continues round the wicket as Stirling is able to reach out to this one down leg to get it away through fine leg. Also gets him to a his fifty. Play on Stirling, play on
defended now from the confines of his crease
backs away before cutting this straight to the man at cover
works with the leg-stump slant to sweep this round the corner
waits on the front foot as he defended with a slightly angled blade
backs away and then picks his spot through backward point to get this all the way to the boundary, despite sweeper cover running to his right to try and intercept it
gets a look at Sammy by defending this delivery on the front foot
clipped away with the angle through backward square
fuller one on the pads which Joyce bunts away to the leg side
runs this one through to third man as the batsmen cross ends
driven with ease to long off as they continue to rotate the strike
defended away to the off side to end the over
nurdled away through midwicket for one
flighted on middle and leg as this is defended from the crease
Joyce gets forward a touch as he plays this away to the off side with soft hands
this time rocks back to whip this away off the pads
tucked away through long on as these two look to build a foundation
driven firmly towards the extra-cover fielder by Joyce
Joyce shows his big-hitting ability with a lofty bludgeon over long off to this fuller length slanting in from round the wicket, with this one climbing many a mile before descending into the stands
gets away a single through extra-cover now to bring Stirling on strike
opens the face to glide this down towards the fly slip
length on middle and leg which is pushed away towards the off side
ends up bunting this back of a length to the silly mid-on fielder
crashed away through point, but picks out the fielder, much to his chagrin
eases away this one dragged by Gayle on middle and leg to the man at long on
carved away off the back foot towards deep point
fires this one wide outside off as Joyce is able to reach out and squirt this away square off the wicket
flatter one from Gayle which is flicked away effortlessly behind square by Stirling
tries to run one down past gully, but the fielder comes forward to field the ball
ends up locating mid-off with a drive off his blade
welcome back Mr. Roach, I have been expecting you. Slams the fast bowler over cow corner for a massive six. Just trusted the bounce and went for it
back of a length delivery just outside off, Stirling pushes it into the off side from the crease
this time opts for the short-arm pull which finds its target at the cow corner boundary, with no fielders nearby in the deep
this time goes for the bouncer in an attempt to upset Stirling's plans, but ends up hurting himself as he is wided for height
defended close to the body on the off side
on a good length and just outside off, Stirling waits for it, opens the face of the bat, and steers it down to third man
length going across the batsman as this is driven straight to mid-off
tries to dab this one past the fly slip, but he has other ideas
short of a length and bunted away to the leg side
goes round the wicket to Joyce as he overpitches this one angling in from outside off, as this is blazed away on the up to the extra-cover boundary
shifts his weight onto the back foot now as he hammers Sammy with a short-arm pull that goes all the way to the midwicket boundary
tries to guide this one past short third man, but is sent back by his partner as he hit it a bit too well to the fielder

this over is hurting the West Indies as Joyce finishes it off with style, flicking his wrists at this fuller length angling in wide of off, with this continuing on through third man to get to the boundary
full on middle and leg as this is turned away towards midwicket
length ball again from Taylor which is fended away by the batsman
fetches this one pitched outside off, and then proceeds to deposit it over deep midwicket with a one-bounce four. Stirling is constructing his innings beautifully so far
Taylor has clearly not learned from the previous ball as he delivers yet another short one outside of off which Stirling is able to get up and under as this flies over the square-leg boundary for six
Taylor is just making this easier for Ireland as he offers a leg-side delivery which is glanced away by Stirling to find the boundary rope once more. Too easy for the opener
short of a length and going down leg as he is able to pull powerfully through backward square to finish the over in some style
no need to have a sighter as he clubs this one dragged on middle and leg to long on
forced through the off side as he gets Joyce on strike
this time blazed away to deep point by the left-hander
gets behind the line of this to smother for any turn
looks to paddle Samuels over his shoulder down leg, but can't get it away as he inside-edges onto the pad
helps this one down to long on to end another good over for Ireland
begins with a length delivery which is parried away to the off side
drops this one short outside off as Stirling moves into the 90s with a deft glide towards third man
opts for the loopy, fuller delivery which is dug out towards the off side

dropped hard to call this a chance, but you need to take these in games like this. Joyce manages to get away a boundary through long leg as he tries to help this shorter one down with a hook, but is not at all in control of the shot. Bravo, at the position in the deep, is able to get a hand on it, before bobbling it on towards the boundary rope
rides the top of the bounce of this Holder special on and around off
fuller one pitched up in the same channel as this is struck straight to short mid-off
continues round the wicket as Stirling carves this away off the back foot in front of square

picks his spot behind square before executing with perfection, getting the width he required to get this away for boundary. Also gets him to his half-century as well. These two are really batting beautifully
eases away a single through the cover region now to get Stirling back on strike
bounces more than he expected as this one turns away to the leg side

and in the most nonchalant fashion, Stirling departs the Saxton after offering an outside edge to this one spinning across him, with Ramdin able to complete the take after it took the edge. Really has been a wonderful innings to set the platform for Ireland in this chase
play-and-a-miss outside of off to end a successful over for West Indies
fullish length outside off which is defended away on the front foot
tried to get away a shot through the off side, but ends up hitting it back towards the bowler
that is a much better line as this one flies past the outside edge
dabbed away through the third man region for a single
just about manages to get away this shortish length which climbs up on him from a middle and leg-stump line
hooked away with ease through backward square as Joyce retains the strike
tries to get this one past the gully fielder, but to no avail
glanced away now square off the wicket
defended away on the front foot
but that should help raise the volume somewhat as Niall throws his hands at this one to get it away through third man for four
inside-edges this one onto the pad as Samuels and Ramdin react excitedly
goes for the tap-and-run outside off before setting off immediately for the other end, which he is able to make under some duress
able to return back for the second after bursting this one through the hands of the short cover fielder
tries to scythe this one through extra-cover, before getting it away more square
lasers away a square drive which allow the pair to scamper for a single
carved away through the same region, with the intention to run two, but is stopped by the flat throw from the deep
pragmatic batting here from Ireland as Niall pushes this one towards cover before getting down to the other end
this time Joyce is able to get it away towards deep extra-cover
half-trekker which Joyce punishes with some disdain as he lifts this over cow corner to get a one-bounce four
blazes away a drive now through deep extra-cover
pushed through around off, Joyce pushes it to point and sets off for a single
Niall decides to go airborne now through extra-cover, but is unable to get it all the way as some nifty footwork on the boundary's edge prevents the four. Also get Ireland to 200
Niall lunges forward to smother any turn
defended away to the off side to end the over
blitzed away through the cover region for a single

short and going across as the extra width gives Niall the opportunity to get this just wide of the long off fielder who was chasing after it, as he puts in a fruitless dive before the rope to try and cut this off
Niall in a hurry here as he lifts Simmons through long off
Ireland is just making this look all too easy as Joyce gets in on the act, pulling this shorter one from Simmons through backward square to find the boundary
too much width on the off side now as Joyce blazes this away to sweeper cover
on the back foot as this is carved past the cover fielder to long off

begins round the wicket and well of the crease as he unleashes a sharp bouncer which the batsman is not interested in at all. Russell then proceeds to do a few hops in his follow through, almost as if he had done something. Hopefully not cramping here too?
tries him with a slow, shorter change-up which Niall is far too early on as he looks for the pull behind square
this time Russell obliges with the correct line to go after as Niall is able to lift this with a flick of his wrists through long leg for four
this time works away a single through the off side as the required rate comes down to just 5.3
plays a nice Calypso flick behind square to rotate the strike
tests him out with a bouncer which is called wide by the third umpire. Nothing going WI's way at the moment
picks up another boundary now, this time through backward point, as he squirts away this short of a length off the back foot
eases away a single through the off side
rushes the batsman a touch as he looks to punch this past point
driven in the gap between point and cover to get off strike
waits on it before choosing his spot at deep extra-cover with a delightful chip that makes it all the way to the rope. Classy stroke from Joyce
darts in a quicker one which Niall is more than content to needle through towards point
dropped Niall once more looking to chip over the same region, except this time cover gets a hand, but is unable to grasp the chance, as this continues through towards deep extra-cover
goes round the wicket to Joyce as this is driven down to deep extra-cover
drilled straight to the man at long off
forces away a drive through mid-off as they are able to complete the single in the nick of time
manages a single down to third man
full and squeezed away through backward point as they run a brace
good slow bouncer which Niall fails to get away off the square
good length delivery outside off stump, Ed Joyce guides it down to a squarish third man
short of length delivery angling away from the left-hander, O'Brien looks to cut but chops it to the keeper
up and over from Niall as he slams this one going across over the extra-cover region for four. Classy strike from NIall
has a waft at this one shaping away outside off, but is unable to make the desired connection
backs away to the leg side as he looks to clobber Holder over cover, but doesn't make any contact
follows him this time with a shorter one which Niall gets away with a rash pull through midwicket

dropped pretty much sums up WI's day doesn't it? Niall doesn't time this one at all as he looks to slam Taylor over cow corner, but the disguised slower ball means this goes straight up to Holder at long on, who fails to take the chance
Niall now makes Holder pay with a lofted shot over a deepish mid-off, who tried to get at it, but this was always going to go over
Niall you beauty ! Someone sign him up! length delivery shaping in from outside off as he is allowed to go through the line to bludgeon this through extra-cover
shuffles over a touch to the off stump as he glances this one behind square to get Joyce on strike. 50 now required off 74
squirts away this length delivery angling in to the cover fielder
tries to carve this fuller one past mid-off, but Russell is more than equal to the task
Niall gets to his half-century with the cleanest of strikes through long off. Has just been out of this world since coming to the middle in terms of performance under pressure
now hooks away this shorter one towards deep square-leg
whipped away off the pads as they initially look for the second, before seeing square-leg with the ball in hand and ready to fire in a throw to the keeper
goes over his treasured long off area with another delightful chip as West Indies' heads sag even lower
over the top again, this time through cover, as he doesn't get enough on it to beat the fielder to the rope
Niall once again goes over the top to this shorter one, but doesn't quite middle it so
full and wide and squeezed away by Joyce through third man to pickup yet another boundary. This was a 147 kph thunderbolt, which probably went away around the same number of knots

and the show must come to a close as Joyce's spirited 84 comes to an end after he holes out to deep cover in an attempt to find the boundary rope. Really has been a wonderful knock to add to the one earlier from the opener, Paul Stirling. The Saxton give him a resounding send-off as he raises the bat to acknowledge the cheers
Niall, who crossed over with Joyce earlier, scythes this one away on the up through cover
searches for the yorker as he ends up on the pads, with Andy clipping this away
too short as Andy doesn't hesitate to get under it. Called wide by the umpire
Andy shows he is no mug with the bat as he blitzes this fuller one through extra-cover to find the boundary
and again from Andy as he bissects the gap between extra-cover and cover to put away another boundary
goes round the wicket as this is glanced away to midwicket
ends up smacking this one off the back foot to the cover fielder
tries to slap away through point, but the fielder puts a stop to that notion
this time slapped away just in front of the fielder as they are able to make it through for the single
nicely on top of this length delivery on and around off
fails to get away Russell off the pads as the over comes to a close
fullish length which is drilled straight to mid-off
short and struck away to point, but stopped in its tracks

shortish length which invites Andy to have a go as he pulls this straight to deep midwicket, who takes it comfortably. What is key here, is the lack of celebration or acknowledgment on the behalf of the West Indies' players. They look quite demoralised out there
continues round the wicket to Niall as he parries this one to backward point
once again looks for the lofted shot over mid-off, but there is fielder placed at long off to take care of that eventuality
fuller one which is drilled to the mid-on fielder
able to get away this short of a length which was cramping him behind square
able to pickup a brace with a slap through point which the fielder fails to field as this continued through to the deep
rides the bounce of this short of a length to parry it to the off side
carved away off the back foot towards deep extra-cover as they are restricted to just the one
defended on the front foot towards the off side
far too early into this pull as he looked to get this over to deep midwicket
little tentative there from Niall as he defended this away through point, as he initially looked for the run before being sent back by Wilson
fires in a yorker which is dug out successfully towards the leg side
goes for the tap-and-run which the pair complete smoothly without any issue
surprises him with a shorter one which he doesn't get a hold off as he tries to evade the delivery
and the pressure does the trick as West Indies snag a late one here, getting Wilson to spoon this fuller delivery straight to short mid-off
able to survive this final ball from Taylor to end a good over for the West Indies

steers this one past point towards the deep. Kevin chugs hard to try and get to the non-strikers when they return for the second, but he is well short of his ground. Doesn't even bother to wait for the umpire's call as he walks back to the pavilion. Ireland in a spot of bother here now as the innings heads towards its denouement
keep calm and trust in the Niall as he is able to glance this length delivery slipping down leg to the long leg boundary. Brings the equation down to 10 now

and with those two blows he seems to have eradicated all the tension that was beginning to fester. Digs deep before bending his knee to slice this through the extra-cover region for four. Beautiful cover drive
now gets to the other end with a drop single as Ireland reach 300, which is greeted with much enthusiasm from the Saxton faithful
misfield at cover makes it just four to win as Chris Gayle at cover fumbles this straightforward take
loud call for no as he defends this one on middle and off towards the off side
attempts a ramp to this shortish length that flies outside off to the keeper at a good height
able to scurry a single as this is worked away to the leg side to get Niall back on strike, much to the crowd's relief
manages to chip this fuller one over to the man at long off as there were some premature roars of celebration, but its not over yet folks
looking for the blockhole as this is drilled straight to mid-off
Mooney hits the winning runs as Ireland cricket reaches greater heights! ends up getting away this pull which catches the edge to fly over the keeper to the boundary
